text: being able to work as an RA straight out
of college has been a great experience
for me I really couldn't have asked for
a better stepping-stone from college to
a further degree when I left College I
really didn't know what I wanted to do
particularly what industry I wanted to
enter law was out there business was out
there but there was no particular reason
to pursue either one working for my
professors I've noticed that I'm really
interested in the intersection of the
languages of the law and economics and
the way one can be used to influence the
other and vice versa and that has
motivated me to go and pursue a jd/mba
once I finished my position here as an
RA and then hopefully in the future
after that to enter into a regulatory
agency such as the SEC or the US
Attorney's Office and figure out ways of
using my education to balance economic
efficiency with accountability the best
part of being an RA is
just being able to stay connected with
my area of interest which is corporate
finance and capital markets but at the
same time also having the flexibility in
terms of my work schedule to balance the
rest of my obligations the rest of my
family obligations gave me the
opportunity to continue to pursue the
way that I think in the way that I do
research but at the same time to explore
whether I want to move into a business
school policy program type academic
setting or if I want to go think-tank
dictate type of research or even I'd be
honest after working here I'm not so
fearful after being a graduate student
of moving back into the private sector
to start a job even even at 25 and
discover a brand new passion an area
that you had no idea that you would be
fascinated by it was completely
exhilarating and working here at HBS
having an RA position which allows me to
get a glimpse into so many different
types of companies really solidified
that for me I realized that what I'm
really passionate about is
public/private partnerships and the
negotiations around those I'm interested
now in the areas where neither the
public sector nor the private sector can
do them alone in terms of clarifying my
goals I initially wanted to go into
development economics and I guess
through the RA position I've been able
to look through a lot of the literature
and get a good sense of also sort of in
a terminal aspect you know if I did go
through a doctoral program what it would
be like a faculty member so yeah I think
it has helped in clarifying my goals in
being more familiar with the literature
as well as the tasks as being a
development economist
